oai_dc:dc.dc:title: NOVEL FRAGMENTATION OF SPIRO CAGE DIONES DURING CE(IV) ION OXIDATION - INTERESTING MECHANISTIC DEVIATION THROUGH SPIRO ANNULATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, V
RAJU, BNS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: olefin metathesis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Oxidation of pentacyclo[5.4.0.0(2,6)0(3,1)0(5,9)]undecane-8,11-dione-4-spiro-1'-cyclopropane (2a) and pentacyclo[5.4.0.0(2,6)0(3,10).0(5,9)]undecane-8,11-dione-4-spiro-1'-cyclopentane (2b) with Ce (IV) ion is described. The treatment of 2a and 2b with ceric ammonium nitrate (CAN) furnishes the isomeric anhydrides 3a, 4a and 3b, 4b and the ketolactones 5a, 5b, respectively. A mechanism has been proposed to account for the observed products.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: INDIAN JOURNAL OF CHEMISTRY SECTION B-ORGANIC CHEMISTRY INCLUDING MEDICINAL CHEMISTRY, 31(11), 725-728
